arts.sum: Last night gave Enzo Maresca another reminder that he has quality coming out of his ears as far as his Chelsea squad goes. The Blues...

arts.ttl: Exclusive: Lamine Yamal convinced Barcelona to let wonderkid seal Chelsea transfer instead, says expert
arts.sum: Lamine Yamal’s rise at Barcelona was a key reason behind the club deciding not to follow up their interest in Palmeiras wonderkid Estevao Willian, who will now join Chelsea in 2025 instead. That’s according to Fabrizio Romano as the transfer news expert spoke exclusively to CaughtOffside for his latest Daily Briefing column about how Chelsea […] The post Exclusive: Lamine Yamal convinced Barcelona to let wonderkid seal Chelsea transfer instead, says expert appeared first on CaughtOffside.

arts.ttl: 'Fantastic': Enzo Maresca says £52m Chelsea player is really sacrificing himself for the team after Barrow win
arts.sum: He was at his best last night.

arts.ttl: I saw 'frustrating' Chelsea player deliver the ultimate game of two halves in victory against Barrow - opinion
arts.sum: Chelsea turned on the style to breeze past Barrow in the Carabao Cup last night, but for one player it was very much a tale...

arts.ttl: Every word Enzo Maresca said on Chelsea win, Nkunku hat-trick, Neto goal, Chilwell display
arts.sum: Football is full of these games, where you underestimate the other team; you concede goals and you concede chances but tonight I think the performance was very good and we showed how serious we are." This has to be one of our targets, no matter how we are going to play, it is important that the identity of the team is always there.

arts.ttl: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca insists his side are 'serious and we want to compete' after 5-0 Carabao Cup rout of Barrow as the Blues boss calls on his side to 'send a message' to their rivals
arts.sum: A hat-trick from Christopher Nkunku, who has started only once in the Premier League, put League Two Barrow to the sword while there was a first Chelsea goal for Pedro Neto.

arts.ttl: Chelsea 5-0 Barrow: Player ratings as Blues breeze into Carabao Cup fourth round
arts.sum: The second came seven minutes later as Malo Gusto's low cross again found Nkunku for a delightful flick beyond Paul Farman in the Barrow goal. The momentum of the game continued into the second half and Neto tapped home an electric counter just two minutes after the restart following a smart cross from Mykhailo Mudryk.

arts.ttl: Chelsea fans fume as Sky Sports camera cuts away at worst possible time in Barrow thrashing
arts.sum: Chelsea prevailed 5-0 to progress past League 2 side Barrow in the Carabao Cup with Christopher Nkunku stealing the headlines by recording a hat-trick at Stamford Bridge
